definition: to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
lit. to open the door and see the mountain; fig. to get right to the point (idiom)
leaving the door open invites the thief (idiom); to invite disaster by giving evildoers a free hand
erhua variant of 半開門|半开门[ban4 kai1 men2]
firecrackers set off at the stroke of midnight on New Year's Day (a Chinese tradition)

sentences.english: Open doors can provide enough draft so that a fire can run wild.
sentences.chinese: 打開門會提供足夠的氣流更會使火勢蔓延。

sentences.english: Before the store opened, countered the prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 在商店開門之前，犯人應道。

sentences.english: He got up and strode to the door.
sentences.chinese: 在他下馬之前，我走去開門。

sentences.english: He said he's coming to open the door as he stepped into his trousers.
sentences.chinese: 他邊穿褲子邊說他就來開門。

sentences.english: We should open all possible avenues and try all possible means to settle problems that arise.
sentences.chinese: 要廣開門路，多想辦法，千方百計，解決問題。

sentences.english: Pinyin is like a kind of 'Open sesame,' opening up the doors," he says.
sentences.chinese: 拼音就像“芝麻開門”，爲人們敞開了大門”他說。

sentences.english: Linear door handle and auto-return to open, humanistic design.
sentences.chinese: 直線式門拉手和開門自動迴歸，設計更具人性化。

sentences.english: If you don't want the door-opening responsibility, try to sit one row away.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不願意承擔開門的責任，坐在別的排上。

sentences.english: Goofys strong play spirit to open the door.
sentences.chinese: 高飛強打起精神去開門。

sentences.english: But Tao will prevail with meat wine through the guts…
sentences.chinese: 打開門，說與君，無花無酒道不成。

sentences.english: This time Old Xu couldn't even get up to open his door.
sentences.chinese: 這次老許甚至沒法起牀開門了。

sentences.english: Peering out his door into the night, he recognized the face of a trusted neighbor.
sentences.chinese: 他開門窺望，夜色中認出是一位可靠的鄰居。

sentences.english: Open not your door when the devil knock.
sentences.chinese: 魔鬼敲門慎莫開，開門必有災禍來。

sentences.english: I with stone, the Hao arrived at that"house" and open a door to go in.
sentences.chinese: 我用石材啊郝離開《屋》啊翻開門出來。

sentences.english: First, open the door, put the washing in and then close the door.
sentences.chinese: 先打開門，把衣服放進去，再關好門。

sentences.english: Jimmy:First, open the door, put the washing in and then close the door.
sentences.chinese: 先打開門，把衣服放進去，再關好門。

definition: to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
to enter a door/to go in/to learn the basics of a subject/to join one's husband's household upon marriage
to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
to open/to show (a ticket)/to turn on/to switch on
to close (a door)/to turn off (light, electrical equipment etc)
